boardgame.name: Clic: El Juego de Fotos
boardgame.description:
Walk around the city taking photos, be a photography student accompanied by the Professor.

Enjoy unique games, you will always play on a different map, your experiences will be different and the strategy will depend on your imagination.
The map is built with cards and players must advance towards the objectives.

Are you ready to become an expert photographer? Whoever achieves the best CLICS will be the winner of the game.

Pasea por la ciudad sacando fotos, asume el rol de un estudiante de fotografía acompañado del Profe.

Disfruta de partidas únicas, ya que jugarás siempre sobre un mapa diferente, tus experiencias serán distintas y la estrategia dependerá de tu imaginación.

¿Estás listo para convertirte en un fotógrafo experto? Quien logre los mejores CLICS, será el ganador de la partida.

boardgame.name: Il Castello al Chiaro di Luna
Helden van het Maanlicht
Mondschein Helden
Moonlight Castle
Moonlight Heroes
Los Valientes del Claro de Luna
boardgame.description:
Your goal in Mondscheinhelden, a.k.a. Moonlight Castle, is to rescue as many gems as you can from a wizard that's trying to pilfer them from a castle. Whoever ends up with the most gems wins!

The gems are on tiles that are shuffled, stacked, and placed inside a cardboard castle. Using a plastic slider that goes under the bottom edge of the castle, players push out tiles to create a row of gems that the wizard is levitating away from the castle.

Each player starts with four colored pebbles. On a turn, you move your figure to a new space on the path of tiles, paying a pebble of the color space to which you move. You then draw pebbles from the bag based on the space to which you moved. Finally, if you can pay pebbles exactly matching the number and color of the gems depicted on the tile, you claim that tile. (You have tricked the wizard into stealing pebbles instead of gems.)

Reveal the bottom of the tile to see whether nothing happens, a number of new tiles are revealed, or you take another turn. Continue taking turns until the magic path tile is revealed from the castle. At the end of that round, count your gems to see who wins.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 UK Games Expo Best Children's Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Dado Batalla
boardgame.description:
Dado Batalla ("Battle Dice") is a board game designed for the little ones, to share and have a nice time with the family.
The main objective of this game is to mark all the numbers of an opponent with the marker tiles as soon as possible. You must roll the dice and mark your opponent's numbers.
Whoever does it first will be the winner of the game!

El “Dado Batalla” es un juego de mesa pensado para los más pequeños, para compartir y pasar un lindo rato en familia.
El objetivo principal de este juego es marcar todos los números de un contrincante con las fichas marcadoras lo antes posible.
Quien lo haga primero, será el ganador de la partida!

boardgame.name: War of the Ring: Deluxe Game Mat
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's web site:

This War of the Ring Deluxe Game Mat matches the size of the limited-edition War of the Ring Anniversary Release board, which was produced in a limited number of copies. Players have been asking for a similar board to be offered as a regular product, and Ares is now producing it, printed on high-quality, foldable material.

The giant neoprene playing mat (128 x 88 cm size) offers an enlarged playing area, 50% larger than the normal board, featuring the amazing John Howe’s depiction of Middle-earth created exclusively for War of the Ring.

Thanks to this deluxe game accessory, players will have a beautiful and durable game board, with even more room to maneuver the 205 miniatures used in the game.

Pre-order Contains:
War of the Ring: Lords of Middle-earth – Treebeard Mini-Expansion (2012)
https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/132430/war-ring...
War of the Ring: Warriors of Middle-earth – Tidings Not Burdens Mini-Expansion (2016)
https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/210039/war-ring...
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: War of the Ring: Second Edition

boardgame.name: The Late Trapper's Lament
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

“You there, marines! I have a task for you. Come earn your keep, dogs.”

Your party has accepted work as marines aboard a cog called Otherworldly Obelisk. The ship has berthed in Ragnarrheim, a Viking town of New Vinland, with plans to continue to Port Zangerios, but some of the expected cargo has not arrived. The local trapper was due hours ago with a bundle of valuable ermine pelts. His tardiness is uncharacteristic. The captain orders you to locate the late trapper and, more importantly, return with the pelts, but something is amiss out in the hoary wilds of Hyperborea.

boardgame.name: Hyperborea Volume I: Player's Manual
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

HYPERBOREA is a role-playing game of swords, sorcery, and weird science-fantasy.…the players create player characters (PCs), including fighters, magicians, clerics, and thieves.

The heroes of a HYPERBOREA game delve dungeons filled with horrifying monsters, lethal traps, and bewildering puzzles; they explore savage wilderness frontiers and dangerous borderlands; they probe ancient ruins and investigate cursed tombs; they match steel against sorcery and sorcery against steel; and they plunder for gold, gems, and magical treasure.

HYPERBOREA is a “flat earth” realm hemmed in by the mystical boreas (“North Wind”), and under the scarlet light of a bloated, dying sun, its roiling seas spill eternal over the world’s rim. This world is in a perpetual state of decay and is populated by disharmonious men and women, hostile monsters, and weird, alien beings.

boardgame.name: Hyperborea Volume II: Referee's Manual
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This book contains five chapters and an appendix.…

CHAPTER 10: INTRODUCTION
The introduction to this work presents Hyperborea in historical and fictional contexts. It also explains some of the responsibilities of the game referee.
CHAPTER 11: REFEREEING
This chapter contains suggestions on refereeing HYPERBOREA. Also, experience point distribution methods are discussed.
CHAPTER 12: BESTIARY
This chapter is filled with beasts, dæmons, monsters, otherworldly beings, and undead creatures that might populate your Hyperborea.
CHAPTER 13: TREASURE
This chapter covers monetary and magical treasure found in Hyperborea: coins, gems, jewellery, magical armour, shields, weapons, potions, rings, staves, wands, and more.
CHAPTER 14: GAZETTEER
The Gazetteer provides key information on the setting, including Hyperborea’s place in the stars, its unique calendar, its history, climate and seasons, flora and fauna, and people. Political and geographical divisions are also discussed, as well as the marvels and wonders of the realm. Lastly, the various religions are detailed.
APPENDIX
The appendix includes several useful resources for the referee to utilize, including rules for weather, hazards, waterborne expeditions, warfare and siege, and an index of this work.

boardgame.name: Regicide Companion
boardgame.description: Companion app for the card game Regicide that also allows you to play the single player version of the game.

boardgame.name: Legendary DXP: 007
boardgame.description: App version of Legendary: A James Bond Deck Building Game.
boardgame.videogamebg: Legendary: A James Bond Deck Building Game

boardgame.name: Notable Novices and Notorious Newcomers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Notable Novices and Notorious Newcomers is as set of optional tables for Old-School Essentials and is compatible with similar clones of the Original, B/X or BECMI editions of the classic fantasy role-playing game.

This e-zine offers three tables:

Who Are You?, which gives a reason why the party quickly welcomes a new party member, such as when a replacement character is rolled mid-session.

What's Your Story?, which provides the previous adventuring career of a freshly rolled character that is level 2 or higher.

The Looted Items table, provides the magic items they've looted during such adventures, and has different columns based on character class.

These tools and tables aim at providing quick, interesting details and at injecting more story into the campaign. Sometimes the results are simple and bear little or no consequence; sometimes a result may produce a significant change in the character’s story.

boardgame.name: 肛門で語る人生 (Komonde Kataru Jinsei)
boardgame.description:
肛門で語る人生 (Komonde Kataru Jinsei) is a trick-taking game from Japan. The game title is a vulgar expression, as the theme of the game is about human’s filthy life. The publisher's blurb says "Throughout life, people accumulate their filth to reach their climax, then fall suddenly.". So the game title translates as 'Life told through the anus'. The box cover shows a purse with a star-like decoration, which is recognisable in Japan as an anus.

The publisher says "In this game, the cards are played out two at a time from a hand of five. At the end of each round, the hand is replenished from the deck, so you always have five cards in your hand. This makes trick-taking a relatively light game.

There are two types of cards in the game: simple numbers 1 to 5 and special cards with the number 0. The special cards are Monko-sama (a monk) and Servant. The person who makes a bigger number with two cards wins the trick (an offering at the temple), but the special cards affect the trick.

If there is a servant played, the player who played the servant wins.
If there is both a servant and a monk played, the player who played the monk wins.
If there is no servant but a monk is played, the player who played the monk loses.
In a battle between monks and servants, the player with the higher number wins.

As you play, the number you play in a round is your 'life experience' and you record this value of the experiences you have talked about. At the end of the game, the total number of experiences is calculated, and the player with the highest total is eliminated from the game as having "experienced too much". Of the remaining players, the player with the highest total of offerings wins the game.

肛門で語る人生は、トリックテイキングと呼ばれるタイプのゲームです。

ありふれたトリックテイキングはカードを配り切って手札から1枚ずつ出していくのですが、肛門で語る人生は、手札5枚の中から2枚ずつ出していきます。ラウンドの最後に山札から手札補充がありますので、手札のカードは常に5枚です。

手札補充があることにより、トリックテイキングとしては比較的ライトなプレイ感に仕上がっています。

1から5までの単純な数字のカードと、0の特殊なカードが2種類あります。

特殊なカードは「もんこう様」と「下僕」です。

基本的にはカード2枚でより大きな数字をつくった人が得点（＝お供え）を獲得するのですが、

・場に、下僕がいる場合、下僕を出したプレイヤーの勝ち、

・場に、下僕ももんこう様もいる場合、もんこう様を出したプレイヤーの勝ち、

・場に、下僕がおらず、もんこう様がいる場合、もんこう様を出したプレイヤーの負け

となります。

もんこう様同士、下僕同士の戦いは数字の大きな方が勝ち、数字が同じ場合は後出しの方が勝ちます。

そのラウンドで出した数字は、このゲームで語ったあなたの「経験値」です。

人生での"経験"を示しているわけですね。

毎ラウンド、語った経験の経験値を、ホワイトボードマーカーでメモっていきます。

ゲーム終了時にこれまでの経験値の合計を計算するのですが、最も合計値が高いプレイヤーは「経験しすぎている」ということでゲームから脱落します。

残ったプレイヤーの中で、最もお供えの合計点の高いプレイヤーの勝ちとなります。
boardgame.boardgameartist: Sasari Hinoe (ササリ ヒノエ)

boardgame.name: Wreckland Run
boardgame.description:
Load up your vehicle with supplies, strap on a few weapons, and prepare to make your wreckland run.

Wreckland Run takes place in a post-apocalyptic landscape known as the Wrecklands that's filled with marauders and other dangers. Wreckland Run is played across a campaign consisting of 7 chapters. With each new chapter, the continuing story will unfold in the campaign book. You will be instructed to open up a new envelope that adds exciting new bosses, enemies, and gameplay twists. The contents of these are secret for now. Do not reveal them until you’ve been instructed to!

At the start of the campaign, you will first choose a vehicle and driver. Choose wisely, as this will be your combination that you’ll carry across all 7 chapters. Once you’ve completed a chapter, you will move on to the next chapter in the campaign, but the enemies and Parts you’ve encountered will remain in their decks, increasing the power of your arsenal but also the ferocity of your foes!

The game is played over three rounds, each consisting of to phases, Wreckage and then Run. In Wreckage you'll repair and outfit your vehicle with new and upgraded parts. In the Run phase, you battle enemies over a series of turns, and hopefully survive to fight another day! You win by defeating the Boss in the third and final round of the game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aberrations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Unknown Reaches Out!

For every intrepid “hero” who probes the secrets of ancient ruins or cosmic frontiers, there is an alien being which will meet them.

The Aberration Bestiary contains a variety of such adversaries utilizing the Spheres of Power and Spheres of Might system, with 20 such entities in all. Ranging from classic foes such as the Aboleth and Drider to the versatile Phrenic Auxiliary to the mighty Great Old One Ravasion, GMs should find no shortage of mighty and distinct foes within this book.

Beyond the creatures themselves, The Aberration Bestiary offers new mechanics for tremendous vehicle-scale creatures, new feats and talents for monsters, and a revised and compiled set of rules for psychological strain mechanics.

Unlock the possibilities of Aberrations and introduce players to dangers beyond understanding.

boardgame.name: Chroniques Oubliées Fantasy Mini
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

DÉCOUVREZ LE JEU DE RÔLE !

Avec Chroniques Oubliées Fantasy - Mini, découvrez ou faites découvrir le jeu de rôle autour de vous !
Cette version épurée de Chroniques Oubliées Fantasy, best-seller du jeu de rôle français, conviendra à toutes celles et ceux qui veulent jouer rapidement et lancer une partie de jeu de rôle avec des règles de jeu à la fois simples et agréables.

Ce livret de 24 pages couleur contient :

une explication du jeu de rôle en BD,
les règles de création et de progression des personnages,
les règles du jeu,
une mini-aventure prête-à-jouer,
un bestiaire de 8 créatures
5 fiches de personnage.

boardgame.name: Ofrendados, the road to Mictlán
boardgame.description:
Ofrendados is a roll and write game where we seek to create the most beautiful "ofrenda" (altar) for our beloved ones and guide them from Mictlán (Land of the Dead) to celebreate with us in "Día de muertos"

The game takes place over 5 rounds, where players draft dice in order to draw "ofrendas" (altars), build the flower path (and trigger bonuses), and collect money and buy "calaberita" (little skull) cards to improve your altars.

The winner of the game is the player with the highest points, accumulated via the flower path, the "ofrendas", the cards and coins. In order to win the player will also need to reach the land of the living in the flower path.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Zombieland: Headshot Fever
boardgame.description:
The award-winning ‘Zombieland VR: Headshot Fever’ is an arcade light gun racing shooter built for VR.

Headshot combos slow the clock, meaning the most precise shooter is the fastest. This gives you more time to rack up combos, get faster times and claw your way to the top of the leaderboards with awesome weapons, powerful upgrades and head-popping, clock-stopping, zombie-killing arcade action!

Taking inspiration from games outside of shooters such as Trackmania, a course takes no longer than a minute, but it will hold your attention for hours as you shave your time, millisecond by millisecond, until you get close to perfection. It's score-chasing heaven!

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1296970/Zombieland_VR_Hea...

boardgame.name: SPIEL die STADT
boardgame.description:
Players cooperatively build a city distributing and placing tiles to build a city. There are three public goals and everyone gets their personal goals, representing demands from different groups of people living in the city. Players can discuss al they like before the tiles are distributed but once the project manager hands out tiles, everyone places them without communicating. The goal of the game is to score as many points as possible, representing how happy the people living in the city are.

—user summary

boardgame.name: ZweiKopfDämon: Supplements aus der Hölle #1
boardgame.description:
Erster, kostenloser Erweiterungsband zu ZweiKopfDämon.

„Supplements aus der Hölle #1“ bietet acht eher unkonventionelle Geschichtsideen zu ZweiKopfDämon. Passend zur Weihnachtszeit haben zwei Ideen einen festtaglichen Einschlag.

Geschichtsideen:
1 - Unheilvolles Suntown
2 - Die Straße
3 - Die verdammte Hölle
4 - Zeit der Emotionen
5 - Metatron 4528
6 - Höllischer Garten
7 - Tödliche Festtage
8 - Das Zuhause des Weihnachtsmannes

boardgame.name: クリスタルと商人 (Crystals and Merchants)
boardgame.description:
A storytelling based game wherein an adventurer attempts to sell items to a merchant.

The adventurer comes up with a backstory for the item, then the merchant must add onto it while attempting to bargain the price down.

If a player fails to come up with something to add onto the story or notices a contradiction in the opponent's story, the game is over and the prevailing side wins.
boardgame.boardgamedesigner: 黒の錬金術学会 (Black Alchemic Society)

boardgame.name: Country of Arduin Map
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Meticulously copied from the original maps of Arduin that David Hargrave drew by hand, kept to the original look, Emperors Choice presents a full 2 ft x 3 ft four color poster-sized map of the Arduin printed on parchment style paper reminiscent of the early Arduin Grimoires.

Arguably one of David A. Hargraves best works.

The map comes complete with legend and scale and displays the civilized areas of the country: roads, cities, towns, villages, etc. as well as all the major geography: forests, mountains (individually named!), swamps, islands seas, lakes ,etc.

You will never be lost in Arduin with this extremely detailed map as your guide!

Map comes rolled and is shipped separately in a tube.

boardgame.name: Arduin Map of Chorynth
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

The poster map measures 17×22 inches, full color heavy stock

The country of Chorynth was originally found in the World Book of Khaas, Legendary Lands of Arduin.

boardgame.name: Battlefields
boardgame.description:
Battlefields is a tactical combat game between two armies of heroes from the Catacombs Universe. First, players will spend points to draft their army of heroes. Then they place their chosen heroes on the hex based neoprene playmat. Different heroes have different movement rates and attacks. Combat is resolved with either dexterity (dice flicking) or non-dexterity mechanics.

The game provides a variety of units for both the Heroic and Lich Lord forces and supports two or four players for multiplayer games. It also features a solo mode.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Catacombs: Red Box
boardgame.description:
Catacombs Red Box is an expansion for Catacombs 3E that allows the game to be played in a fully co-op fashion. This includes support for solo play. The expansion also adds new heroes, monsters, Catacomb Lords, and items for Catacombs 3E. It also adds new content for Catacombs & Castles 2E. The set includes custom dice and a new obstacle for use in either game: the "Trilithon".

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Gloomy Eyes
boardgame.description:
The darkness awoke the dead from their graves. A decade after the sun retreated and twilight engulfed the world, an oppressive leader has made being a zombie against the law, their very existence is illegal. They are forced to hide in the forest, away from dangerous zombie hunters. At night when the hunters retreat into their homes, the cold sunless world becomes calm and quiet. A zombie kid called Gloomy wanders alone, out of sight… This zombie is different. Truth is, he doesn’t feel too comfortable around others of his kind. Gloomy is not like other zombies. He has something inside him that we can’t see or understand.
But Nature knows he’s special.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1111620/Gloomy_Eyes/

boardgame.name: Gadgeteer
boardgame.description:
Gadgeteer is a physics-based VR puzzle game where you build chain reaction machines to solve fun, intricate puzzles. Your machines will use gadgets to launch, bump, twist, and turn—creating chain reactions that may even end up tearing apart the fabric of space-time.

Prepare your wits because you'll need them to build your masterpiece!

https://store.steampowered.com/app/746560/Gadgeteer/

boardgame.name: Clue: Disney Villains
boardgame.description:
CLUE Disney Villains edition puts a decidedly wicked new spin on a classic favorite.

The Villains are up to no good once again, causing mischief and mayhem within their vile realms. A mysterious spell has opened the passages to nine realms once forbidden to the six diabolical Villains, and now each wants what the other has.

Do you dare enter the Villains' lair to figure out which Villain stole which enchanted object and uncover where it is hidden?
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)
Versions & Editions: Disney Theme Park Editions

boardgame.name: Death Lap
boardgame.description:
Death Lap is a VR combat racing game that challenges you to drive to survive. Just point and shoot to destroy everything in your path. Hit the road, perform drifts and stunts, navigate traps, unleash your weapons and special abilities, and enjoy the chaos of its battlefields.

A darkly comic, combat racing game that will leave you howling with laughter as you put your life on the line. Captured by Nitro Saint Payne — a maniacal yet tragic man, you are thrown into his deadly TV show where you must race and battle other drivers to win your freedom.

Features
Choose your car and use its weapons and powers to change the game.
Enjoy various environments and take advantage of its traps, paths, and obstacles.
Increase your speed with boosters and NOS fuel.
Control your car in first or third-person view.
Battle solo or with friends to test your might and speed.
Rank in the Global Leaderboard.
VoIP chat to communicate with your opponents.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Player of the Game Tennis
boardgame.description:
Player of the Game Tennis is much like our other games in the Player of the Game lineup. It plays rapidly, but offers enough detail and action to give you the story of the match.

In Player of the Game Tennis, each player is individually rated for their service game both first serves and second serves; their complete ability when receiving (again how they handle the opponent's first serve or second serve); ability to hit game winners or game losers in some cases. Other factors, like a player's fitness, whether he is a favorite, ability to handle adversity, major and minor injuries are all included. Did we mention that all of the factors above are broken down by playing surface? All aspects of a tennis match are covered.

Player of the Game is easy to learn and easy to understand. You'll be playing in no time. Each match will unfold in front of your eyes at a brisk pace. A full match in Player of the Game tennis take no longer than 10 minutes. Most matches will be completed in 5 minutes!

The base game includes a fictional Men's Tour and a fictional Women's Tour with complete schedules, prize money, a points system, and even tournament brackets. Everything needed to play is included in the base game.

If you want to add real players, you can purchase any of our season year books.

If your favorite player isn't rated (which isn't likely), we give you a method to put them in the game!

The Printed game features all players on die-cut cards printed in vivid color.

Step on the court today, it is all Aces with Player of the Game Tennis!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pe Tang 1900
北京・北堂の57日
boardgame.description: Pe Tang 1900 is a solitaire wargame depicting the 57 day siege of the Catholic Cathedral in Peking by the Boxer rebels in 1900. The Cathedral, packed with fleeing Catholic Chinese, was defended by 12 Italian sailors under the command of Sottotenente di Vascello Angelo Olivieri and about 40 French soldiers under the command of the Enseigne de Vaisseau Paul Henry. Their courage and resilience managed to save many lives until the relief of the Cathedral by Japanese soldiers on August 16th, 1900. The player’s mission is to defend the Cathedral and resist up to the end of turn 12, when the relief column will arrive.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn: Kickstarter Edition
boardgame.description:
The Kickstarter editions comes packaged with 3 expansions not contained in the retail edition - The Fire Temple Monsters, The Kaharian Monsters, and The Shade Events.

The goal of Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn is to introduce co-operative play into the Valeria world through groups of related books called Sagas. These books will lead the players through a story that unfolds during the game and offers greater immersion into the Valeria setting. New rules and cards will be introduced in each book, some lasting only through the current book and some persisting through the unfolding Saga, somewhat like a "legacy game".

Darksworn uses six book-decks to tell a story of wonder, sacrifice, and adventure as you explore the territory west of Valeria and encounter a darkness that cannot go unchecked. Each book presents you with a set of new rules and several tasks that must be completed by your gaming group in order to advance to the next book in the saga. Within each book you'll find special boons to assist you and powerful monsters to challenge you. Your team will have to strike a balance between building effective tableaus of citizens that will allow you to complete the tasks and defending the decreasing center stacks of citizens that are the health of your kingdom.

The play area for Darksworn is much the same as an ordinary game of Valeria: Card Kingdoms, but there are some notable changes. The story board sits above the monster row. This is where each book's story and challenges are presented, where new rules are displayed, and where citizens captured by monster attacks languish in a dark oubliette. Walls provide additional protection from the attacking monsters, but if they make it past the walls, your citizen stacks are going to suffer. At the bottom of the play area is the Blessings Board where your devotion to the radiance of Aquila can grant you special powers, free captured citizens, and even rebuild fallen walls. If any of the monsters make it through to the Blessings Board, however, all is lost.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Fire Temple Monsters

boardgame.name: Underwater Cities: The GiftForge Insert
boardgame.description:
Tested with premium sleeved cards.
This product does not require assembly.

Insert size: 30,9 cm x 22,3 cm x 5,1 cm.
If you only store the base game components than the product won't lift the lid, but the New discoveries boards lift the lid a little (separate storage for the boards is suggested).
Material: 3 mm birch wood.

boardgame.name: Anachrony: The GiftForge Expansions Insert
boardgame.description:
Tested with premium sleeved cards.
This product does not require assembly.

Insert size: 33,5 cm x 24,5 cm x 4,8 cm.
The product won't lift the lid.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.

boardgame.name: κλεφτοκοτάζ (Chicken Thief)
boardgame.description:
Chicken Thief is a real time game of observation and quick reaction! In includes 3 games, for different children development levels:

A) Grab the Chicken
Cornelia the Chicken is craving a treat of a specific color! Check your card. If you have that color, be the first to grab the chicken by the neck, to get rid of your card!

B) Coop Party
Cornelia the Chicken is now asking for a specific number of veggies!Count the veggies on your cards and if they match the number, grab the chicken first to get rid of them!

C) Go Figure!
This time, Cornelia the Chicken is asking for specific items. Search among the cards spread on the table and be the first to spot the item to win its card. First player with 7 cards, wins the game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mascara
boardgame.description:
Who's behind the mask? A mystery game for 2 players. Choose whether you want to be the detective or join the criminal Red Circle.

The Hideaway
The Masked Man chooses where to hide on the game board and covertly writes down the corresponding letter on the sheet of paper.

This is the Masked Man’s hideaway. The Detective mustn't see this letter.

The Investigation
The Detective begins his search for the Masked Man by taking a coin from the Coin Reserve Zone and placing it on a free corner of the game board.

The Masked Man treats this coin move as an enquiry.
He answers yes if he is hiding in any of the squares adjacent to where the coin has been placed. Only squares directly touching the coin square count (not diagonal squares).

He answers no if the coin has been placed beyond those squares OR if the Detective has placed the coin directly on his hideaway.

The Detective moves the coin to a free square adjacent to the current square - including diagonally - and proceeds to repeat his enquiry.

The Raid
After a total of three enquiries, it is time for The Detective to make a raid. The Detective says in which square he thinks the Masked Man is hiding.
The Masked Man then reveals the letter he wrote on the sheet - thereby identifying his hideout.

If the Detective is correct then he WINS the round and places the coin face down in
the square with the Masked Man’s hideout.
If the Detective is wrong then the Masked Man WINS the round and puts the coin in the Masked Coin Area.

The first player to win three coins wins the game.

The game is presented on a vinyl 7" gatefold sleeve including a record produced by Timothy J Fairplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Video Buzzer
boardgame.description:
Trivia Buzzer game, with an LCD screen, in which luck and good judgement also matter!

It includes 2 modes of difficulty, one for children and one for the whole family.

In your turn, you move your pawn on the board, answering questions to gather points. On special squares, everyone can bet on whether the active player will answer correctly, to win some extra points. Race first your pawn to the finish line and be the player with the most points to win the game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Timefold
boardgame.description:
Timefold is a trick taking card game played in teams of two. Each round, the players have to predict the exact number of tricks they will win.

Players know their own cards and those of their teammate.

A correct prediction or „bid“ earns points. The team with the most points at the end of eight rounds of play wins the game.

Each player also has a unique set of abilities, that can be used to temporarily change the rules of play.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Einfach klasse in Mathematik-DUDEN 2010
boardgame.description:
4 games for the first handling of numbers are offered in this collection for the pupils of the 1st and 2nd grade elementary school.

Card pairs trains memory and continuous counting, you uncover pairs of cards with the same value or the same number or the same number and write down the value of two pairs found in several scores, who has the highest sum at the end, wins.

Fast task rotation poses arithmetic tasks with the help of the rotating arrow, first number tiles are uncovered, with which then the task is to be solved, who achieves the highest sum from two of three results, wins.

Arithmetic Quiz requires solving arithmetic problems in two difficulty levels for first and second grade.

Shape Puzzles provides a first look at geometric shapes and how they interact for larger and other shapes by laying shapes analogous to Tangram. The laying puzzles give the new shape and the number of pieces given for it, while the corner puzzles give the pieces needed and the number of corners the new figure must have.

boardgame.name: Wandering Monsters (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the wandering monsters in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Wandering Monsters is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Wandering Monsters (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the wandering monsters in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Wandering Monsters is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Hirelings of the Old World
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four ‘Honest’ Hirelings for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay

The Old World is steeped in threat. Death can be found in the unnatural creatures circling at the edge of civilisation, in the whims of a cold hearted noble, or at the blade of a desperate thief. Few can make it alone, and there is no shame in spending good coin for good help. Even the most competent band of adventurers can find themselves in need of a specialist’s help.

Enter the Hirelings, useful folks who know their skills are in demand, and who are happy to accept coin in return for service. Of course few people who choose to make a living in this way come without some kind of baggage, and one must always be wary of loyalty purchased with coin...

Hirelings of the Old World includes four unique hirelings, each with their own set of skills, their own demands for payment, and detailed background and plot hooks to draw the Characters into their lives. Of course, taking on the concerns of another can bring troubles all of their own...

Hirelings of the Old World includes:

Luhrghur ‘Lantern’Angryfist: An Ogre Mercenary with a proven record of accomplished and brutal service, and a particular taste for Beastmen. For the right price, Lantern boasts, he can put on a fabulous magic act — in particular he excels at making people disappear.

Lirwen Amberbloom: A Wood Elf Spy who found the insights of the criminal underworld to be far more useful than the waffle of courtly gossipers, Lirwen excels at gathering information. Whether local gossip or a detailed profile on a mark, the Wood Elf excels at providing insights — for a price.

Henrietta ‘Corny’ Cornflower: A Halfling intent on climbing the rungs of the Empire’s social ladder, Corny left her humility behind her when she departed the Mootland. Still, her observations into the upper echelons of the Empire are insightful, and for the right price she can provide access to the sort of places that some Characters would be tossed out from in an instant.

Angela the Red: A human Hunter of notable skill, Angela serves as Master of the Hunt to Lord Hans Taalhoffer, though her lord allows her leeway in providing services to others. She is an excellent guide and trapper, but has little need for coin. She demands payment by way of favour, and the favours she requests can quickly grow in scope.

boardgame.name: Blood and Bramble
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Before ever Teclis pondered the notion of Human wizards, and long before Magnus the Pious laid the foundation for the Colleges of Magic, there was still magic in the land that would become the Empire. To the Witch Hunter it is all base witchery, and its practitioners worthy of little consideration and a good deal of kindling. Those who know a little better recognise that there are distinctions to be made. Witchcraft is the shortest path to power, be it ever so soaked in blood, while the Lore of Hedgecraft is more subtle, its many paths disappearing into the brambles at the edge of civilisation. Which sounds more appealing? Come closer, and learn for yourself...

Blood and Bramble is a collection of 24 new spells, a dozen each from the lores of Witchcraft and Hedgecraft. These spells expand the offering found in the core book substantially, and greatly expand the capabilities of non-college practitioners. This PDF also includes each spell as a printable spell card, so you can easily add them to the magic already found in the WFRP rulebook.

For the GM who wishes to make use of these new spells a pair of NPCs are also provided. Old Mar of Diesdorf is a Hedgewitch who, when she forgets herself, claims to have see Magnus the Pious in the flesh. Her counterpart is The Elsewise Witch of Gubtenreich, a sheep farmer who found more coin in whispered spells than shorn ewes. Both come with a detailed stat block, intriguing plot hooks, and a knowledge of arcane lore that could prove useful or deadly, depending on how they are approached.

Blood and Bramble is the perfect addition to any player Witch or Hedgewitch’s arsenal, but can also be of use to GMs in creating NPC adversaries with unexpected magical abilities.

boardgame.name: Geometric Sniper
boardgame.description:
Immerse yourself in Andrew's story and feel the pressure of being a sniper. Find and eliminate the target in the crowd before he runs away.In living environments, designed exclusively for this fantastic game, you will not have a second chance, precision is everything!

Publisher Blurb

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Légion – Ornithoptère Raddaugh Gnasp
Star Wars: Legion – Raddaugh Gnasp Fluttercraft Unit Expansion
boardgame.description:
Defend Kashyyyk with the Raddaugh Gnasp Fluttercraft Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! A compact scout craft used to patrol the dense wroshyr forests of Kashyyyk, this fluttercraft is fast, deadly, and packs a nasty sting. Whether harrying the enemy with bowcaster fire or expertly- lobbed grenades, the fluttercraft is a formidable addition to the Wookiee arsenal.

Within this expansion, you’ll find everything you need to add a Raddaugh Gnasp Fluttercraft to your Republic armies as a support unit. A beautifully detailed, unpainted hard plastic miniature brings this unit to life on your tabletop, while a unit card outlines all of its capabilities, including the new Overrun keyword. Finally, five upgrade cards invite you to choose exactly how this unit behaves in combat.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: ShadowDark RPG Core Rules (Beta)
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Shadowdark is a fantasy roleplaying game where you delve into subterranean dungeons, caverns, and tombs in search of gold and glory.

The Shadowdark is a vast network of buried and forgotten ruins brooding beneath the surface world. It clutches ancient
secrets and dusty treasures in its rotting claws, daring fortune seekers to tempt their fates.

With your adventuring companions at your side, you confront the Shadowdark's sinister traps, ancient magics, and ruthless monsters.

If you survive, you'll return to the surface with marvelous
riches plucked from the depths. And before long, you'll hear the Shadowdark's call once again!

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Légion – Super Droïde Tactique
Star Wars: Legion – Super Tactical Droid Commander Expansion
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your tactics with the Super Tactical Droid Commander Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! An upgrade over the T-series Tactical Droid, the Separatist Alliance often calls upon these ruthless droids to serve as generals in their armies. Relying on cutthroat tactics, they will stop at nothing to accomplish their objectives.

This expansion contains everything you need to deploy your own Super Tactical Droid to battle your foes, beginning with a beautifully detailed, unpainted hard plastic miniature that can be assembled in three distinct poses. Meanwhile, three unit cards give you the freedom to choose the specific Super Tactical Droid to lead your army, whether it’s a standard model or the infamous Kalani or Kraken. No matter which droid you choose, three command cards help your Super Tactical Droid bend the battle to their will. Finally, six upgrade cards invite you to further customize your droid to fit your battle plan.

-description from publisher's website

Star Wars: Légion – Plateforme de Soutien d'infanterie

Battle in any environment with the Infantry Support Platform Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! An immense rear-mounted turbofan and powerful repulsors make this a true all-terrain vehicle, helping the Republic meet its foes on any battlefield. Featuring armaments that punch significantly above its weight, its paired pilots can direct each weapon individually, or link them together to take on larger prey.

This expansion contains one finely sculpted Infantry Support Platform miniature along with everything you need to add it to your Republic armies as a heavy unit. boardgame.name: Nightmare Garden of the Space Princess
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

A Lo-Fi, late-night TV horror movie adventure for 1st level characters.

Nightmare Garden of the Space Princess is a dungeon crawl adventure compatible with Shadowdark RPG. Works with a squint and a smudge for any other retro-clone system.

Crawlers delve into a nightmare garden of xenobiology and bizarre extraterrestrials.
The fate of the world hangs on how well the crawlers can make friends with a space god.

Vibes are stoner rock, drive-in movie, cosmic horror, and funhouse dungeon.

boardgame.name: Kazad Mor
Kazad Mor: The Cursed Dwarfhome
Kazad X Mor
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

A classic dwarven fortress dungeon crawl for 1st level characters.

Kazad Mor: The Cursed Dwarfhome is a dungeon crawl adventure compatible with Shadowdark RPG. Works with a squint and a smudge for any other retro-clone system.

Crawlers delve into the cursed, abandoned halls of the dwarves.
They delve for gold, glory, and magic. They delve to find the truth of the fortress and its abandonment.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – NR-N99 Persuader-class Tank Droid Unit Expansion
Star Wars: Légion – Tank Droïde NR-N99
boardgame.description:
Lead the assault with the NR-N99 Persuader-class Tank Droid Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! This fast, heavily armed tank droid is surprisingly well suited to even the most difficult terrain thanks to its massive central tread. Its wide side sponsons can accommodate a full unit of battle droids and transport them directly to the front lines.

This expansion contains everything you need to add a NR-N99 Persuader-class Tank Droid to your Separatist armies as a heavy unit. The beautifully detailed, unpainted miniature features two option B1 battle droids that it can ferry into battle and a unit card outlines all of its weapons and systems. Finally, nine upgrade cards invite you to outfit your NR-N99 Persuaderclass Tank Droid with additional shells, comms, and programming.

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: Legion – Clone Wars Core Set

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – IG-100 MagnaGuards Unit Expansion
Star Wars: Légion – Magna-Gardes IG100
boardgame.description:
Protect key Separatist personnel with the IG-100 MagnaGuards Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! These implacable droids are programmed as unflinching bodyguards for key Separatist commanders like General Grievous and Count Dooku. Armed with deadly electrostaffs and precision blaster pistols, the menacing MagnaGuards will continue to fight after losing limbs– or even their head!

This expansion puts a troop of six highly detailed, unpainted hard plastic IG-100 MagnaGuard miniatures at your command, enough for two special forces units. In addition to their standard electrostaffs, these miniatures can be assembled with a variety of alternate weaponry, including an RPS-6 rocket launcher, an electro-whip, and a unit leader that can appear with a precision laser dart. Additionally, eight upgrade cards give you even more options for your MagnaGuards, including two heavy weapons.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Hexagone
boardgame.description:
Hexagone is an accessible abstract strategy game for 1-4 players. Claim the most Hexagones to win the game. Compete against your friends to make the most connections, or play solo to discover your inner grand master.

Build the block, roll the dice, connect the colours and claim the Hexagones.

On your turn you have 2 rolls of the dice. The colours rolled dictate which Hexagones you can move. To move a Hexagone simply swap it with an adjacent piece of any colour. Connect 3 or more matching coloured pieces to claim them. If you roll a double, you get to swap a piece of that colour with any piece on the block.

The board evolves with each roll of the dice, make sure your victory pile grows too!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Decs Building
boardgame.description:
The whole neighbourhood competes to see who can decorate their house in the most tasteful, elegant display of brightly- coloured lights in the run-up to Christmas. Every square metre of your house has to be blasting out light if you want to stand a chance of out-Holidaying the Joneses!

2-4 players compete to put on the most impressive Christmas lights on the front of their houses by spending cards to build their decks, install power lines and put up decorations, drawing their display out on individual grids. When the big day comes you don't want to be left with unpowered lights or empty walls.

Decs Building is intended to be printed on the inside face of a Christmas card to friends or family, and in addition to the self-contained card, requires only components many families will already have around their houses: coloured pawns from e.g. Ludo or Pachesi, a couple of decks of regular playing cards, and a pen or pencil and paper for each player.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pass the Pasta
boardgame.description:
Grab matching pasta shapes from the grid to make tasty sets in this simple, yet strategic card game!

On their turn, a player can either collect card(s) from the grid or bank 1-7 matching cards from their hand. As no one starts the game with cards, everyone must collect from the grid on their first turn.

Collect card(s) from the row and column that the chef's hat is on. If there are multiple matching cards, you get to take all of them (as long as it doesn't take you over 7 cards in your hand!). Draw new cards to replace the card(s) you collect, and move the chef's hat token to a newly placed card. All cards, apart from the card underneath the chef's hat, are face up. Instead of selecting the available face up cards, players can choose to take the mystery face down card underneath the chef's hat.

Collect the biggest sets, while cunningly moving the chef's hat to stop other players grabbing the pasta they want. Create the same set as another player and you can shout "Pass the Pasta" and steal one of their cards... but be careful not to lose points by making things too al dente! Whenever you bank less than 3 cards, you must take the al dente token and place it in front of you.

The game ends as soon as the draw pile runs out. Each banked card is worth 1 point at the end of the game. The player with the al dente token must minus 2 points from their score. Whoever has the most points, wins!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Doomsday Project: Episode 3 – The Battle for the North
boardgame.description:
This game combines with the Battle for Germany game and the Battle for the Balkans game to cover the entire European Front in a hypothetical World War Three in 1985.

The game will add additional rules, which can be retrofitted in the previous games, for naval warfare.

Norway, Sweden, and Finland will be covered showing the Warsaw Pact attack on these countries. Denmark's role will be expanded.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Supernatural Stories 80 SRD
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Supernatural Stories 80 SRD is the complete and free version of the rules used in the Supernatural stories 80 series of role playing games.

Supernatural stories 80 is a minimalist roleplaying game that fits on 2 pages. This role-playing game can be adapted to all modern/fantasy settings (horror, witchcraft, supernatural fights...).

What makes SUPERNATURAL STORIES 80 unique?

The specificity of Supernatural stories 80 is to introduce 4 power tiers: human, monster, master, immortal.
These tiers constitute barriers of power that make it very difficult (but not impossible) to fight against superior entities. Thus, dozens of humans will have almost no chance to defeat a well-trained vampire.
For epic settings, the SRD provides special rules for advancing from tier to tier.

In two pages you get:

a system of rules based on five attributes only
super simple combat and action resolution
explanation of power barriers and ways to break them
essential reminders of the 80's pulp spirit to handle the game

boardgame.name: The Van in The Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your van has broken down in front of a scary place (again)! On your way to a student festival, you'll have to deal with a supernatural threat. Vampires, werewolves, ghosts... What will you have to survive this time? Fortunately, the 80's student never loses the sense of festivity!

The Van in the Night is a super light horror RPG about students who break down in the middle of nowhere. The starting pitch is inspired by Scooby-Doo, The Faculty, Scream, and the general atmosphere of 80's movies like Ghostbusters, Night of the Living Dead, Freddy...

YES, the characters are humans facing monsters
but
YES the characters can defend themselves

The Van in the Night contains the following elements:

ultra-light rules system
specific rules for horror
specific objectives for each character that have real *repercussions on the gamea
a bunch of tables: monsters, artifacts, items and clues
four no-prep tables: to allow you to start playing immediately

boardgame.name: Weird Humans vs Supernatural
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Legends are true: monsters live among us. Vampires, ghosts, werewolves, they have always been there. Some hide, some stalk humans, but all are fighting to survive in a world that is hostile to them. But recently a new kind of monsters have appeared: Demons. No one knows how they arrived, but one thing is certain: they are coming to devour us!

After all, something like this was needed to even out the odds...

WEIRD HUMANS VS SUPERNATURAL is a light horror RPG about superhuman hunters who hunt down the monsters that roam the Earth. Play as a cyborg, ninja or hunter and fight the supernatural forces on equal terms!

Weird Humans vs Supernatural contains the following elements:

ultra-light rules system
specific rules for play humans with extraodinary abilities but in need of humanity
a bunch of tables: monsters, clues, real-world amazing places
three no-prep tables: to allow you to start playing immediately

boardgame.name: Mushroom Shaman
boardgame.description:
As civilization raged on, it spewed pollution and litter behind. Species died. Food dwindled. Depression and anxiety rose.

One day, explorers ventured into the last remaining jungle, searching for the mythical Mushroom Shamans. They came eager to find meaning, solutions, and happiness.

You are one of these legendary Mushroom Shamans. Spurred by the enthusiasm of your new followers, you embark on a mission to grow your cult and save the planet.

You will race against your fellow competitors by sending your followers out to forage, grow, and consume mushrooms to heal the earth and fight inner demons.

You must hurry because increasing pollution and destruction will damage your foraging grounds. However, you must be cautious. Inexperienced mushroom consumers may face severe consequences.

Mushroom Shaman is a worker placement and engine building game for 1-6 players where players forage, grow and comsume mushrooms to heal the earth and fight inner demons.

Players allocate followers to complete various tasks to achieve victory points. Tasks consist of foraging and visiting 6 locations on the shared game board: cave, forest, market, plains, river, and village. Additional tasks are located on individual grow chamber boards. Here, followers can grow mushrooms, create medicinal tinctures, and colonize grain.

The goal is to reach 8 victory points, with victory points representing the success of your cult. The game immediately ends when a player reaches 8 victory points. That player wins the game and crowned the greatest Mushroom Shaman.

boardgame.name: The Morning Show
boardgame.description: In this game, it's a battle of the radio stations as you try to make your station's morning show the best in town! Play songs from a constantly rotating request line deck que. Play cards from your hand to line up the sponsors and guests and remote locations. The more you give the listeners what they want, the more points you score and the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Il Palazzo Di Jabba – un gioco Love Letter
Star Wars: Jabba palotája – A Love Letter Game
Star Wars: Jabba's Palace – A Love Letter Game
Star Wars: Jabba's Palace – Ein Love Letter-Spiel
Star Wars: Jabbův palác
Star Wars: Le Palais de Jabba – un jeu Love Letter
Star Wars: Palacio de Jabba
Star Wars: Pałac Jabby
Палац Джабби
boardgame.description:
The lair of Jabba, the Hutt is a place of danger and deception. Players compete using members of the Rebel Alliance and denizens of Jabba’s Palace in a game of rebel bravery and vile deceit.

Based on the beloved card game and set in the Star Wars galaxy, Star Wars: Jabba’s Palace - A Love Letter Game retains the simple and fun mechanics of the original as you utilize the talents of iconic characters from Return of the Jedi. Players take turns using the elegant “draw a card, play a card” gameplay and then executing the card’s effect. Cards include characters like Luke Skywalker, Boba Fett, Salacious Crumb, Jabba the Hutt, and many more, with each card offering different effects, such as Boba Fett allowing you to take a card from another player, or Salacious Crumb allowing you to look at another player’s hand.

Players use abilities from members of both the Rebel Alliance and Jabba’s crew to outwit and outlast the others. On top of the classic mechanics from the original Love Letter game, Star Wars: Jabba’s Palace - A Love Letter Game also introduces Agenda cards. This offers new win conditions, adding another level of strategy to the game.

Agenda cards like Exalted One awards the player with the highest number in hand the win. However, cards like Jabba’s Court and Rescue Mission switch it up and award the victory to the player with the most Palace or Rebels cards, respectively, in the play area. These and other Agenda cards ensure varied strategies will be needed with every game beyond simply eliminating other players.

In a quick card game of rebel bravery and vile deceit, can you carry out your agenda while outthinking your foes?

-description from publisher's website
