Publisher's blurb:

The December 10, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The December 17, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The December 24, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: 50 Fantasy Ghosts
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So you want to populate that fantasy community or adventure location with a few ghosts, spectres, etc… what about the details surrounding their past life? This handy roller chart helps you come up with those in a jiffy. Included in each entry is the ghost’s first and last name, gender, role in life, age at time of death, how many years ago they died, and details about the cause of their death.

boardgame.name: 50 Fantasy Ghosts 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So you want to populate that fantasy community or adventure location with a few ghosts, spectres, etc… what about the details surrounding their past life? This handy roller chart helps you come up with those in a jiffy. Included in each entry is the ghost’s first and last name, gender, role in life, age at time of death, how many years ago they died, and details about the cause of their death.

boardgame.name: 100 Humanoid Translations
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different statements in a strange foreign tongue along with what the statement means. This can be used for fantasy, sci-fi, mutant settlements, etc. Perfect for when you want the party to overhear something but not necessarily understand what is being said.

boardgame.name: 100 Space Pirate Ship Crew Mates 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 100 list contains a bunch of star faring scoundrels for you to add to the roster of a pirate ship’s crew. Either use this list as a whole to flesh out big ships or randomly roll to stock smaller vessels. Each entry includes: Name, descriptive and roll, carried weapon(s).

boardgame.name: 100 Bits of Subway Chatter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different snippets of overheard chatter while traveling on a modern subway. Use this product to add distractions when someone is trying to eavesdrop… or perhaps even pick up new clues!

boardgame.name: Instant Goblin Den Adventure Maker
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Got a gaming group coming over on Saturday night and you need a quick side adventure? Want these explorers to run into a den full of thieving goblins? Don’t have time though to throw something together yourself?

We’ve got you covered!

This handy guide features numerous charts that allows you to quickly create a side adventure focused on a cavernous den full of goblins and their ruthless leader(s). Simply grab a pencil, a set of polyhedral dice, print off an extra copy of the Adventure Maker List (page 6) provided in this file, and start rolling!

boardgame.name: Coastal Colony Roller
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dot Those Island Maps With Random Colonies…

Are you creating a high seas setting full of colony settlements and ruthless pirate action? Do you have a hard time coming up with details for various coastal communities? Then use this random roller!

This product allows you to quickly flesh out some interesting details about a coastal settlement, town, or small city. This product’s charts provide details regarding the community’s name, total population, interesting detail about the community, main local commodities, and imports that are in high demand. The charts also provide the GM with the ability to roll up brief details regarding an interesting encounter or two that the adventurers may run into while visiting the coastal colony.

boardgame.name: TerrorHog
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sightings of giant hogs have increased alarmingly in the Kissimmee River swamps east of Sarasota. There have been a few Elvis sightings as well, but, hey, it's Florida, right? You'll be playing a film crew here to confirm the existence of "TerrorHog" on film. A savage attack at a photo shoot caught the station's attention. The two models are presumed dead, although authorities were unable to find enough of their bodies to officially confirm. The photographer and his assistant were found wandering around the swamp in a near-catatonic state, babbling incoherently about tusks.

This book contains all the rules you need to play the TerrorHog Crawlspace scenario.

boardgame.name: Bible "Trivia": Authorized Supplement
boardgame.description: Authorized supplement to the original Bible "Trivia" game (1984), "the game where trivia is not trivial". Provides 2,100 new and challenging questions from the King James Version of the Bible, with some additional questions of Biblical significance.

boardgame.name: 7TV: Fantasy
boardgame.description:
7TV: FANTASY is a tabletop skirmish wargame inspired by the myriad of cinematic fantasy worlds and the books and games that inspired them. Battle over the tabletop pitting sword and magic against dark lords, endless hordes and villainous sorcery!
—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Expansion Set 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hey GMs, got a problem PC giving you fits? Well your problems are over, Fat Dragon Games has a torture room for your game! This set is completely decked out with all kinds of devices to eliminate that pesky character, from racks and iron maidens to guillotines and cages. We also give you the ability to customize the model textures before printing with stains, blood splatters, skeletons and more.

boardgame.name: Expansion Set 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You've asked for more dungeon props and we're delivering! This set includes bookcases (4 shelf options and three colors of wood), broken tables, grungy bedding, crates of various sizes and spiral staircases your minis can stand on. Our DRAGONLAYERS options allow you to customize these models before printing, and our easy to follow, full color instructions make assembly a snap!

boardgame.name: Expansion Set 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Yep, that's right, we're bringing you 14 all new killer traps for your E-Z Dungeons layout. From hammers springing out of the floor and giant spikes to poison gas and buzz saws, we've got your termination needs covered! Heck, we've even got sharks (sorry, no frickin' laser beams attached to their heads.)

boardgame.name: Expansion Set 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Yep, that's right, we're putting LAVA into the dungeon (along with plain water AND raw sewage!!)

boardgame.name: Expansion Set 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

MORE PROPS! That's right, here is an all new prop expansion for E-Z DUNGEONS to stock your dungeons with crates, barrels and treasure chests!

boardgame.name: Expansion Set 9
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

MORE PROPS! That's right, here is an all new prop expansion for E-Z DUNGEONS to stock your dungeons with sarcophagi! This all new expansion set for E-Z DUNGEONS includes seven different sarcophagus styles, in both easy-build versions and complex opening model with removable inserts. This set also features our Dragon Layers and full color instructions!

boardgame.name: Expansion Set 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

MORE PROPS! This all new expansion set for E-Z DUNGEONS includes everything you need to furnish a bar or tavern. This set also features our Dragon Layers which allow you to customize the model's appearance before printing and full color instructions!

boardgame.name: Expansion Set 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your dungeon just got more deadly! This all new expansion set for our wildly popular E-Z DUNGEONS terrain line brings you a customizable eyebeast, a massive slime cube complete with skeletal remains that can be placed over miniatures to engulf them, two fireplaces, four different altars and a new staircase. This set also features our Dragon Layers which allow you to customize the model's appearance before printing and full color instructions!

boardgame.name: Mummy's Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

E-Z DUNGEONS offers gorgeous 3D dungeons in the popular (and often neglected) 1 inch scale for your miniature games. All models are designed with the novice card modeler in mind. All art is full color and 300 dpi resolution for maximum detail. This expansion pack for the popular EZ-Dungeons brings you a mummy's tomb suitable for any 1" scale miniature game. Set includes 3D card model room with fully detailed wall paintings and a sarcophagus. The pieces of this set are fully compatable with E-Z Dungeons master set.

boardgame.name: Hilltop Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Fat Dragon Games is proud to present Hilltop Ruins, an exciting new expansion to our best selling E-Z DUNGEONS series of miniature terrain. Hilltop Ruins includes a 3D hilltop with three different base options, pillars (both intact and broken) and a stone altar.

boardgame.name: Baba Yaga's Hut
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Baba Yaga's Hut is finally here in glorious 3D!

boardgame.name: Depths of the Drow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Depths of the Drow takes you deep within a drow outpost, complete with arachnid-themed dungeon walls, doors, plenty of items and more. As a bonus, this set also includes expansion pieces for our Mines of the Mountain King cavern terrain set! Our terrain systems allows you to create fully modular 28mm scale terrain layouts for your RPG or wargame, in a downloadable PDF format, and once you have the set you can print and build as many pieces as you like and never run out or need to purchase more. Additionally, our layer options allow you to customize your terrain to suit your tastes. This new PDF terrain set features our exclusive modular E-Z LOCK terrain designs, allowing you to disassemble and easily store your designs between games.

boardgame.name: Dungeons of the Mountain King
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Dungeons of the Mountain King is the third release of Fat Dragon Games' unprecedented epic dwarven citadel terrain series. Our terrain systems allows you to create fully modular 28mm scale terrain layouts for your RPG or wargame, in a downloadable PDF format, and once you have the set you can print and build as many pieces as you like and never run out or need to purchase more. Additionally, our layer options allow you to customize your terrain to suit your tastes. This new PDF terrain set features our exclusive modular E-Z LOCK terrain designs, allowing you to disassemble and easily store your designs between games.

boardgame.name: Halls of the Mountain King
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Halls of the Mountain King is the first release of Fat Dragon Games' unprecedented epic dwarven citadel terrain series. The E-Z LOCK terrain system allows you to create fully modular 28mm scale terrain layouts for your RPG or wargame, in a downloadable PDF format, and once you have the set you can print and build as many pieces as you like and never run out or need to purchase more. Additionally, our layer options allow you to customize your terrain to suit your tastes. This new PDF terrain set features our exclusive modular E-Z LOCK terrain designs, allowing you to disassemble and easily store your designs between games.

boardgame.name: Mines of the Mountain King
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Mines of the Mountain King is the second release of Fat Dragon Games' unprecedented epic dwarven citadel terrain series. Our terrain systems allows you to create fully modular 28mm scale terrain layouts for your RPG or wargame, in a downloadable PDF format, and once you have the set you can print and build as many pieces as you like and never run out or need to purchase more. Additionally, our layer options allow you to customize your terrain to suit your tastes. This new PDF terrain set features our exclusive modular E-Z LOCK terrain designs, allowing you to disassemble and easily store your designs between games.

boardgame.name: Kaosball: Ringer Pack – The Survivor
boardgame.description:
The Survivor is deadly and will never stay down, no matter how many times he gets hit!

If The Survivor would be killed or knocked down, you may instead bench him and replace him with a bruiser or runner (the kill doesn't count).

This miniature was an exclusive promo from GenCon 2016.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination

boardgame.name: The Spoils: Resource Pack
boardgame.description: Contains: 9 Obsession, 9 Greed, 9 Deception, 9 Elitism, 9 Rage, 3 Micromajigs and 2 tournament factions.

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Revised Edition
boardgame.description: The Revised Edition for Magic: The Gathering rewrites the rules for greater clarity, introduces new symbols to the cards, and replaces several of the original cards with those from the first two expansions.

boardgame.name: Joy
boardgame.description:
Bring on the dice! Joy is a turbulent running game for the whole family, in which you compete against each other in 2 teams and collect valuable elements in the form of cubes to be the fastest to bring them back to the common starting field.

Use run cards to skillfully move your pieces across the board and collect the coveted cubes. Beating the figures of your fellow players is explicitly allowed!
Joy cards give you a variety of tactical actions to give your team an advantage or to slow down your opponents.

Thanks to the numerous possible combinations and the random arrangement of the elements at the beginning of the game, no two games will ever be the same.

The team that is the first to deliver all the elements it is looking for wins the game.
But beware: collusion is forbidden!

What are you waiting for? On your mark, get set - Joy!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gärtner und Schnecke
boardgame.description:
The gardener and the snail start at their houses near space 1. The players roll a die and move their pieces accordingly. The first to get to the cabbage (between the spaces 29) takes the cabbage and tries to get it into his house. If the other player gets on the same space as the one with the cabbage, he steals it . At space 13 the players may change tracks. The player who gets the cabbage into his own house wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Suicidium: Party
boardgame.description:
In the Suicidium Party expansion you'll find two dice and 23 new cards illustrated by Marco Tonus to add to the basic deck for 5/6 player games.

And that's not all, in addition to the additional set of nice object cards - noose, poison, razor blade and, new entry: the harakiri - here are for you many answer cards with unpredictable effects and 6 character cards that assign each participant a special power at the start of the game!

boardgame.name: Wer jagt wen?
boardgame.description:
The players (cat and mouse) take turns to place a tile showing their animal on the game board. If cats or mice are enclosed by the other, they get flipped over to change from mice to cats or vice versa. When all spaces are covered, the player whose animal has the majority wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Sandwich MasterClass
boardgame.description:
Sandwich MasterClass is a game in which you express your culinary creativity and improvise the most surprising recipes with the ingredients you gather.

Make Sandwiches, preferably good ones... And win the new season of Sandwich Masterclass!

You're the head of a food truck and have been invited to take part in the new season of Sandwich Masterclass! Will you be able to put together the best sandwiches in a hurry to delight the jury's taste buds? Will you be able to follow the themes of the day? You'll find out when you take part in Sandwich MasterClass!

boardgame.name: Dr. Proteus' Forbidden Files: the Reaper Airship
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enough of those threat assessments the Lightning League has produced. Get the information straight from Doctor Proteus. Now the not so good doctor takes aim at his rude and annoying rival -the Skeleton. The man is a death obssessed headcase, but he built a great new airship -the Reaper! Of course. 3+ pages of deck plans, notes, and the inside line on sabotaging the darned thing.

boardgame.name: Rise of the Necromancers: Undead Sea
boardgame.description:
Undead Sea is the totally new expansion for Rise of the Necromancers, and it comes with a new game board with new lands to explore, new items to find, new Necromancers to play, and new apprentices to bind to your will! And let's not forget all the new Monsters to defeat and raise!

Our Isle being flooded as a result of summoning the Demons, we are reduced once more, lowly and wretched, and must set sail to the West to seek vengeance on the Forces of Light.
Finding the wrecked bones of broken ships and merging them with our Soul Fragment, we sail into uncharted and treacherous waters. We must venture forth to explore unknown lands in search of powerful treasures. Encountering ancient threats, we defeat them and they soon become our most powerful minions.

New victory conditions add further challenges! Now, not only do you have to be first to place your 13 Dominion counters, you must hold a city of the Light, too! Being evil just got harder!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The OpenQuest Companion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book focuses on maximum gaming fun, presenting modular rules that add excitement to any D100 game.

The One Magic System. I first used this quick magic system for convention games. Here it is, expanded and balanced for campaigns which do not need (or where you don’t want to use), OpenQuest’s standard Three Magic System.

Membership. Want a quick game-mechanic to measure how responsive your character’s organisation is to their calls for help? Then the optional Membership (Organisation) skill is the answer. Use it to track your character’s ups and downs in the organisation’s favour and to gain access to the organisation’s benefits. An extension of the rules for Ranks, in the core rulebook’s Magic chapters, these now also cover non-magical organisations such as guilds.

Adventuring Associations. So, your merry band of adventurers have formed a party that has endured at least one caper and they want to create a shared base of operations? This article shows the benefits of the characters creating their own adventuring association or joining an existing one. Also, it is an example of how to use the Membership skill.

Deities List. A generic list of readymade religions for you to use in your game.

Near-Death Experiences. When a character should die, the player spends a fortune point to avoid the final curtain call. Instead of just falling unconscious, until the combat is over, they end up caught between worlds. The valuable insights they can gain while waiting to come back to life are covered in this article.

Other World Quests. This article explains what exactly happens when the characters go adventuring in the Other Worlds.

Realm Quests. This article details how to define nations and states in OpenQuest, and the Quests that arise because of events in the realm.

WAR! The realm is ablaze with conflict. This article deals with the consequences of war to the adventurers, no matter their power to affect the final outcome.

Quick Quest. Meet the rules I use at my table to streamline the game even further, without short-changing the players.

Quick Encounters. Classic D100 Encounters tables by terrain type, to spice up dull journeys.

boardgame.name: The Moongate Dossier
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You create your operative using the rules in the core rulebook... and wonder why your future superspy has 28%'s in so many skills? Why would SECTOR trust the safety of the free world on someone like YOU? Well... they wouldn't. You're a rookie. You're expected to bodyguard prisoners, pick up dead drops, and plant surveillance in empty hotel rooms. You're supposed to do the light busy work while more experienced spies save the day. You need to prove yourself. If your GM wants to fast forward a little, get you past this raw recruit, fresh-out-of-training stage, you can use this supplement. It glosses over your rookie career, gives you a few background missions that helped make you what you are today. Use it in a group "session zero" to give your teammates shared experiences. Or use it alone individually to have unique experiences to bring to the team!

This supplement includes 100 rookie mission experiences, 20 edges, 20 flaws, and 10 recruitment methods you can use to round out your agents and make them unique members of your team. All in a light package!

boardgame.name: Bluey Scavenger Hunt Game
boardgame.description:
"Meet Bluey! A loveable, six-year-old Blue Heeler dog, whose everyday family life becomes a playful adventure. It's almost time for bed, but Bluey and her friends want to play a game of Scavenger Hunt. The Bluey Scavenger Hunt Game is all about finding, playing and collecting. Players must work together as a team to find 12 toy tokens.... This fun game is full of fun activities to perform, fun things to find and fun questions about Bluey to answer."

-description from publisher's website

In this game, the players must work together as a team, just like in the show, to win the game! On your turn, you will roll the die to move around the board. Most of the spaces you land on ask you to do something fun—either find, play, or think! If you can do it, then you will win 1 toy token for the team. And if the players can together collect 12 toys before bed time then everybody wins the game! But if the clock makes it all the way to bedtime first, then nobody wins. But don't worry, you can always try again!

Components: Game Board, 20 Find Cards, 10 Play Cards, 35 Toy Tokens and 4 Player Pawns with bases.

-description from instructions

boardgame.name: Sriwijaya
boardgame.description:
Discover the Jewel of the Maritime Silk Road

The lush islands of the Malay Archipelago overflow with trade goods and adventure. Learn about the different people and places of GURPS Hot Spots: Sriwijaya, including historical highlights, travel hazards, cultural details, and character-creation ideas.

This sourcebook about the thalassocracy of Sriwijaya expands the possibilities for campaigning in the most famous pre-modern land and sea network for international trade, particularly when combined with GURPS Hot Spots: The Silk Road. Not only is Sriwijaya useful for historical adventures, but it also offers tips for combining the setting with other GURPS realms, such as Dungeon Fantasy, Horror, and Banestorm. What will you find when you brave the open seas?

- Publisher's description

boardgame.name: Overlords of Dimension-25
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Overlords of Dimension-25 is a role-playing game and setting inspired by the pulp science fiction roleplaying games of the late eighties and early nineties. Those games were, in turn, based upon the novels, comic strips, and movie serial adventures from the 1930s about a man frozen in time for five hundred years.

Dimension-25 is a strange alternate universe in which our solar system more closely resembles the pulp science fiction of the 1930s and 40s.

In this game player characters are refugees from our Earth transported to this strange dimension via a freak accident. There they discover a world ravaged by five hundred years of interplanetary war, a world where fighters from the Earth Resistance struggle to overthrow the oppression of the Martian ARES Consortium. In this strange and alien world the player characters become adventurers and explorers seeking the ancient ruins of the Terran Empire in search of clues that might lead to a way home.

boardgame.name: Hypergates of the Lost Empire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hypergates of the Lost Empire is an adventure scenario designed for Overlords of Dimension-25, an OSR-style science fiction roleplaying game inspired by RPGs from the early 90s based on the pulp-era exploits of a man transported to the 25th century.

The rules are based upon and similar to those of the world’s most popular fantasy roleplaying game. Before playing this scenario the gamemaster and players should become familiar with the Overlords of Dimension-25 game rules or those of its inspiration.

This adventure scenario is a sequel to City at the Edge of the Universe, but can be played as a stand-alone story.

Hypergates of the Lost Empire can also be used with other OSR-style science fiction roleplaying games with little to no modification. A hit point is still a hit point and an armor class is still an armor class.

This adventure scenario is designed for 4-6 player characters of 3rd to 5th level. The player characters should include at least one character displaced from Dimension-Prime - that is, our modern dimension - and one medic. If there are none, the gamemaster should add one or more support Non-Player Characters (NPC) - specifically someone displaced from Dimension-Prime and a medic equipped with a bioscanner, a trauma kit, and an auto-surgeon.

This adventure scenario assumes that player characters are either agents of the Earth Resistance or freelance operatives hired by them. If the characters represent a rival faction, such as the ARES Consortium, Solar Syndicate, UEA, Lunar Union, or Trade Confederation, the mission is essentially the same, only the details change.

boardgame.name: The City at the Edge of the Universe
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

On January 7, 2029, the Pennsylvania National Laboratory conducted the first of a series of groundbreaking high energy experiments. In a freak mishap the entire lab along with the nearby towns of Williamsburg and Buck’s Head were thrown out of their universe and hurled into the strange new world of Dimension-25.

Welcome to The City at the Edge of the Universe, an adventure scenario for the Overlords of Dimension-25 RPG.

This is the story of regular people transported through a freak interdimensional incident to the strange and dangerous world of Dimension-25. This adventure scenario is unlike most in that there is no linear narrative and no set end-point. This adventure scenario is designed to serve as an origin story for the player characters - a prologue to the story of the campaign. This is the story of how the player characters found themselves in this weird universe and how they became involved in - well, that’s what this adventure scenario is designed to find out.

This adventure is a “survival hex-crawl”. The information provided in this book is meant to present a situation to the players and a variety of destinations available for them to explore. Where they go and what they do is entirely up to them.

The “End” of this story determines the direction of the rest of the campaign. Will the player characters be heroes of the Earth Resistance? Will they become smugglers with the Trade Confederation? Will they turn to a life of organized crime and perform elaborate heists with the Solar Syndicate? The answers all depend on the choices the players make and the obstacles they overcome.

The City at the Edge of the Universe provides rules for creating characters from our modern world who are transported through a strange dimensional rift to the futuristic world of Dimension-25.

The City at the Edge of the Universe adds three new classes to Overlords of Dimension-25:

The Charmer
The Civilian
The Expert

The City at the Edge of the Universe also adds modern weapons and equipment as well as vehicles - both modern and futuristic - and vehicle combat rules.

boardgame.name: Bat Country
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

On their travels, the PCs find the body of an unlucky wastelander named Fig Nootonne (named after a pre-war treat), which leads them to a run-down gas station previously inhabited by the deceased wastelander. Fig’s last wish is for someone to finish her mission to retrieve precious bat guano from a nearby irradiated batcave and deliver it to the nearby town of Cavern City, built into the ruins of an old airport, to be used as fertilizer. However, delivering the guano comes at a steep cost.

boardgame.name: Marmot Falls
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is 1992 in the Pacific Northwest.

Harold Huntington, the wealthy owner of a local fishery in Marmot Falls, is found dead, his car driven off the road and partially submerged in the Leloba river. According to the police, Huntington died on impact when crashing into a large rock jutting out of the water. No foul play is suspected. Huntington was talking to his daughter, Mercedes, on his cell phone while driving, and this distraction might have been the cause of the accident. A rumor has spread that Mercedes heard her father say, “What the hell is that?!” moments before plowing through the guardrail and plunging into the cold water.

The only witness to the accident is a local conspiracy theorist and hermit, Terry Gumble, who claims that he saw a shimmering figure appear in the middle of the road, which caused Huntington to swerve. According to Gumble’s statement, Huntington is part of a shadow government cabal planted in Marmot Falls to test out a new mind-control drug on the population, and Gumble believes that Harold Huntington failed his alien taskmasters and was eliminated as an example to the rest of the Huntington family.

Although the idea of extraterrestrial overlords running Marmot Falls sounds a little far-fetched, you can’t help but wonder what Huntington actually saw on the road that night…

WHAT IS MARMOT FALLS?

In a nutshell:

A unique Pacific Northwest town setting in Gloaming County with 30+ locations

A supernatural murder mystery with an open, improvisational structure and ending + optional "sidequest"-style events for when you want to take a break from the investigation

30 quirky and memorable NPCs, each with their own personality and stats (21 of the NPCs are ”major NPCs” who have their own motives and alibis for killing Harold Huntington)

An area map of Marmot Falls

boardgame.name: Ecologies: Hidden Habitats
boardgame.description:
Ecologies: Hidden Habitats is the third game in the series, it is playable as a stand alone game or used in combination with the previous two ECOLOGIES card games.

Players build and maintain food webs in diverse environments. Healthy ecologies reward you with bonus powers and perks. Watch out though, as others may decide it’s easier to disturb and degrade your ecosystem than nurture their own.

Designed by a biology teacher, the game includes 76 unique organisms, 7 biomes, and beautiful vintage Victorian art. (108 cards total)

Cards are arranged with plants/algae on the bottom and predators on top. Players negotiate trades and use biotic and abiotic factor cards to affect their webs and the webs of players around them. It is a race to get to 12 victory points, with players using different strategies such as focusing on one biome, going for perks and bonuses, or disrupting other ecologies.

Gameplay is rooted in authentic science, as it is used in the classroom to teach real concepts to biology students. While it is scientific enough for the classroom, it is also strategic enough for any game night.

The points system is based on ecological trophic levels. The producers (plants) are worth less and as you make your way up the pyramid organisms are worth more, as it takes a lot of energy to sustain them. In real life only roughly 10% of the energy makes it from one level to the next, meaning you have to have acres of land and hundreds of animals just to sustain one apex predator.

This game is a sequel AND an expansion. When using the game as an expansion, you can customize the deck to include cards from all three games, including cards you love and excluding ones you don’t. Some players love aggressive “take that” mechanics, while others find them stressful. Some players love particular healthy ecology bonuses, while others feel they are overpowered. With multiple decks, you can create a customized experience to fit your group.

If you’d like to maintain the same game length and feel, we recommend choosing 10 factor cards and 7 different biomes.

Note: more cards = a longer game

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Dosdediez (Número 10 - Jul 1999)
boardgame.description:
Dosdediez
Número 10
julio de 1999
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)

boardgame.name: Dosdediez (Número 11 - Nov 1999)
boardgame.description:
Dosdediez
Número 11
noviembre de 1999
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (3rd Edition)
Lord of the Rings Adventure Game

boardgame.name: El Retorno de Jack el Destripador
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

El Retorno de Jack el Destripador - una campaña oficial.

No recomendado para menores de 18 años.

boardgame.name: Kodiak: l'île aux saumons
boardgame.description: In this fun hand management game, you have to carefully play your cards. Play your bears to steal your opponent's salmons and make sure that your salmons do not get caught by the other bears.

boardgame.name: Workshop of Horrors - Bloodlusting Nutcracker
boardgame.description: A follower for Mörk Borg characters.

boardgame.name: Dosdediez (Número 12 - Feb 2000)
boardgame.description:
Dosdediez
Número 12
febrero de 2000
boardgame.rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: The Judge Child
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
"FIND THE CHILD WHO BEARS THE EAGLE MARK!

In humanity’s bleak future, a city with a population numbering in the hundreds of millions is watched over by a totalitarian regime who invests its Judges with the authority to dispense instant justice. Life in Mega-City One is a dazzling panoply of bizarre outfits, outrageous fads, short-lived highs and excruciatingly long lows. The gigantic Citi-Blocks and crumbling tenements of yesteryear shelter a hodgepodge of people and aliens, all largely striving to survive the daily grind of the Big Meg. But life doesn’t just stop at the walls of Mega-City One. The Cursed Earth still shelters life to some extent, the inhabitants of Texas City hold proudly to old traditions, and alien visitors from other planets transit to Earth on a daily basis. Although most citizens stuck in the doldrums of Mega-City life rarely think about it, humanity’s reach has grown to extend far into other galaxies. A rare lucky few manage to escape their city’s boundaries in search of a new life on distant planets. Much more than an expansive look at the epic saga from the comic story line, the Judge Child supplement also offers all the tools and guidance necessary to run the titular campaign plus any number of games set in the deep reaches of space within Judge Dredd’s galaxy. Prime your engines and stow your equipment, its time to propel yourself into the stars! Requires the Judge Dredd & the Worlds of 2000 AD core rulebook.

The Judge Child supplement includes:

New origins, species, careers and Judge options
Expanded equipment and rules for interstellar travel
Two new scenarios plus guidance for running the Judge Child saga
A gazetteer of the galaxy and its inhabitants
Requires the use of the Judge Dredd & The Worlds of 2000 AD core rulebook."
boardgame.rpg: Judge Dredd and the Worlds of 2000 AD

boardgame.name: Museum: Pictura – Patron Pack
boardgame.description:
The Patron Pack contains all the goodies and additional content unlocked during the Museum: Pictura Kickstarter campaign, including several mini-expanstions, Solo Mode, new Favour and Patron cards, and more!

Includes,
- 1 Museum Solo board
- 11 Exhibition cards
- 24 Favour cards
- 19 Patron cards
- 1 First player standee
- 4 Wooden score tokens
- 4 Discard mats
- 30 Event cards
- 18 Assistant tiles
- 12 Artist cards
- 5 Value Token
- 11 Great Pictorial Works cards
- 32 Influence tokens
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

boardgame.name: Revenge of the Foaming Mutant: Interactive Fiction Experience
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Someone is gonna pay!

You've been exiled from Dome City 004 into the Foul Wastes for a crime you didn't commit and it's time to get revenge - or burst a blood vessel trying.

Revenge of the Foaming Mutant is a solo interactive fiction microgame written and illustrated by Andrew Walter. You'll need dice, paper, pencil and some double-sided counters.

- Unique 'rage management' combat system!
- Mutated environments to explore!
- Three separate win conditions!
- Dumb humor!
- Gallons of FOAMING RAGE!

boardgame.name: Blackout
boardgame.description:
When Rob Evers gets a big promotion at work, a celebration is in order. After a wild night out on the town, Rob wakes up in a dark alley with no memory of his actions and the disturbing sense that he might have been involved in something. Only he can't remember what. With a sinking feeling in his gut, he checks his pockets and finds a several strange items along with a series of voice messages on his phone. When he calls his friends, they even tell him that he left the bar with a woman. Rob has no memory of the night at all and is worried about what he might have done. Retrace Rob's actions from the night in question and determine all of the things he did during his Blackout!

Difficulty Rating – 7/10

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for September 2021.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Conspiracy
boardgame.description:
A hidden message in The Valley Falls Observer leads to the conclusion that all is not what it seems. Is the message simply the result of a typo, a practical joke, or mere coincidence? Or is there a deeper conspiracy working behind the scenes of Valley Falls?

Difficulty Rating – 7.5/10

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for August 2021.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Screamland
Welcome to Screamland
boardgame.description:
Screamland is Valley Falls' #1 haunted house attraction. Customers drive from all over
Thornmire county to experience the fun and frights that Screamland has to offer. The experience becomes all too real,
however, when Bekah and Erich Rosenbalm go missing. Their last known location? You guessed it: Screamland. You and
your colleagues at the Will Street Detective Agency are hired by Bekah’s parents to find the missing couple. Will you
confront humans wearing the faces of monsters or monsters wearing human faces? In Valley Falls, anything is possible!
Screamland is ready and waiting for you. Get your ticket now for the scariest attraction in Valley Falls!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Difficulty Rating -TBD

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for October 2021.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Heavenly Struggle -strayside-
天獄ストラグル -strayside-
boardgame.description: Visual Novel

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 554 - January 2022)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 554
January 2022
Ignorable Theme: Asking one PC to roll Notice Something or Save vs Something alerting the other PCs: Good point. Has anyone figured out how to handle this without alerting the other PCs?

boardgame.name: Lost Seas
boardgame.description:
There is a host of terrible tales surrounding the mysterious uncharted depths of the Lost Seas. Rumours of giant krakens, infernal maelstroms, huge sea serpents and hostile deserted islands abound, and only skeletal shipwrecks remain as testament to tentative past expeditions. It is time to arm yourselves with the latest instruments of navigation and prepare to set sail on your most daring expedition yet, knowing that if you succeed, the glory will be beyond your wildest dreams and your map will become the stuff of legends.

Forge your own legend by charting your exploits in the terrifying and hostile Lost Seas. Only the most perilous and daring journey will go down in history.

Plan your Expedition
Explore the dangerous depths of the Lost Seas
Map your perilous journey


—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Lost Seas Publisher: Blue Orange Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian Portugese

boardgame.name: Spin Circus
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the big artists' evening! You will have to wow the public with the best acrobatics on the Ferris wheel. The first player to reach the end of the star-studded round will become the star of the evening.

Can you work together with the acrobats to be the star of the show?

Roll the acrobat dice to know which acrobat to play with.
Move the acrobat clip on the wheel, the wheel will spin and tell you which numbers to use to move your piece … and someone’s else!
Carry out your act and advance, or backtrack on the stage!


Reach the end of the track first to get a standing ovation!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Spin Circus Publisher: Blue Orange Language(s): English German French Spanish Italian

boardgame.name: Next Station: London
boardgame.description:
The city of London has commissioned you to redesign its underground network! Optimise connections, serve as many sights as possible and exploit the tunnels that pass under the Thames. Be careful to respect the specifications set by the city.


Reveal the next Station card.
Draw a new section
Optimise the 4 tube lines


Who will be the best project manager?

Which of you will be the best project manager?

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Next Station: London Publisher: Blue Orange Language(s): English French

boardgame.name: Museum Suspects
boardgame.description:
DRRRiiiiiiiiinnnnng! Hurry, close the doors, a museum piece has been stolen! The director calls in a number of highly skilled investigators to find the thief or thieves amongst the 16 suspects held inside the building. Some clues are more valuable than others. Find the best ones to solve the case while obstructing your competitors' investigations!

The culprit and his possible accomplices may still be around!


Look for a clue in one of the museum's rooms.
Cover your tracks to deceive your opponents.
Accuse a suspect by deduction.


What will be the outcome of this case? Will you find the culprit(s), unless they have escaped before the closing of the doors?

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Museum Suspect Publisher: Blue Orange Language(s): English French

boardgame.name: The Ranchers
boardgame.description: The Ranchers is an open world country-life sim for 1-4 players. Raise animals, grow crops, craft machines, build your dream house

boardgame.name: Films
boardgame.description: Films is an 18-card microgame in which two players take on the role of the heads of major film studios. Using the "Simultaneous Action Selection" mechanic, where the player who needs the fewest weeks of pre-production work will choose first, players will hire the best possible crew, search for the perfect script, fight for big prizes, and try to avoid negative reviews and production problems. At the end of the game, whoever manages to sell the most millions of tickets for their film will be the winner.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: The Rise of Azathoth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's description:

In this 32-page timeline for Fate of Cthulhu, your heroes will face Azathoth, the Nuclear Chaos.

Azathoth, the Nuclear Chaos, sits at the center of all things. It is the sole true power; the universe as we know it and everything within it is but a momentary dream of Azathoth, the sleeping god. But dreams can be dangerous. Azathoth imagined the Darkness and the Nameless Mist as great powers like itself, and these dream-powers spawned the Great Old Ones, whose family tree is long, dense, and twisted.
Now, Azathoth is in a prison of its own imagining. The Great Old Ones, aware of their status as figments in the dreams of an alien god, take measures to ensure their continued existence. Through all their endless battles with each other, they are unified in one cause: keeping Azathoth asleep. It has been rendered insensate and lulled into perpetual slumber. Should Azathtoth awaken, even for a moment, the entirety of creation will vanish, reduced to the fading memory of a bad dream.

This is your mission. Get ready to travel to the past—and face the source of all.

boardgame.name: Build the Castle
Ehita linnus
Построй Kрепость
boardgame.description:
Each player builds his/her own castle with different characters like princess, knight, cat, ghost or dove.
But only the players with the most characters/completed towers score points at the end of the game.

Each round players choose one card from the table and place it on his/her castle face up to make it higher of face down to make it wider. All patterns must be continued on each adjacent card.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most characters in each type / completed towers scores 3 points. The player with the 2nd best scores 1 point.
Player with the most points is the winner.

Different variants for playing and scoring included.

boardgame.name: Sagospelet Äventyr: 1. Regler (4th Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sagospelet Äventyr är saga, rollspel, lek och pyssel på samma gång. Under spelet skapar ni en berättelse i den magiska världen Masona där ni upplever fantastiska äventyr.

Berätta en saga tillsammans och låt spelarna lösa problem, övervinna hinder och få belöningar i slutet av sagan. Kombinera spelet med pyssel, lekar och aktiviteter för de yngsta, allt i samma värld. Rid på drakar, besök undervattensstäder, rädda prinsar från farliga monster och bli hjältar!

boardgame.name: Sagospelet Äventyr: 2. Ariba (4th Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sagospelet Äventyr är saga, rollspel, lek och pyssel på samma gång. Under spelet skapar ni en berättelse i den magiska världen Masona där ni upplever fantastiska äventyr.

Berätta en saga tillsammans och låt spelarna lösa problem, övervinna hinder och få belöningar i slutet av sagan. Kombinera spelet med pyssel, lekar och aktiviteter för de yngsta, allt i samma värld. Rid på drakar, besök undervattensstäder, rädda prinsar från farliga monster och bli hjältar!

boardgame.description:

Sagospelet Äventyr är saga, rollspel, lek och pyssel på samma gång. Under spelet skapar ni en berättelse i den magiska världen Masona där ni upplever fantastiska äventyr.

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sagospelet Äventyr är saga, rollspel, lek och pyssel på samma gång. Under spelet skapar ni en berättelse i den magiska världen Masona där ni upplever fantastiska äventyr.

Berätta en saga tillsammans och låt spelarna lösa problem, övervinna hinder och få belöningar i slutet av sagan. Kombinera spelet med pyssel, lekar och aktiviteter för de yngsta, allt i samma värld. Rid på drakar, besök undervattensstäder, rädda prinsar från farliga monster och bli hjältar!

boardgame.description:

Sagospelet Äventyr är saga, rollspel, lek och pyssel på samma gång. Under spelet skapar ni en berättelse i den magiska världen Masona där ni upplever fantastiska äventyr.
